description: Difference between n-th pronic [=n(n+1)] and average of smallest prime greater than n^2 and largest prime less than (n+1)^2.
comments: a(1)=-0.5 which is not an integer
example: a(4)=0 because smallest prime greater than 4^2 is 17, largest prime less than 5^2 is 23, average of 17 and 23 is 20 and 4*5-20=0
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jul 12 2000
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Jul 13 2000
